reviewText: This movie has a lot of sentimental value, since right when I hit puberty my hormones were uncontrollable, and I found this flick on late one night on cinemax. I saw the first "Young Lady Chatterley" two years prior, and didn't know they released a second one until that night. When I viewed it, I was absolutely stunned about how much beauty that was captured. The first one I was amazed by, but the second had twice as much sex and the woman are much hotter. Of course, some of them are and were to be B-movie playboy softcore porn stars. That is when I developed my fetish for maids, nylons, stockings and garter belts...it drove me nuts. It is quite a deliciously naughty tale with many naughty women that ended up on the naughty side of life. The handsome gardener is one of the biggest studs in B-movie softcore history. Sybil Danning was the hottest actress of the time to be capured on film. Harlee McBride is quite the slutty, horny adultress, who lays everybody with a Johnson, and Monique Gabrielle is a scene stealer as the dizzy, permissive blonde maid. Today this film is not as radical as it was when it was released in 1985, but it still holds its ground in softcore porn history. Alan Roberts keeps us consistently entertained without a credible plot. This movie is all about succulent beauty, nylons and garter belts. Everyone gets a piece of the action, even the young innocent stud Virgil, who gets four maids at once! Very hot.

reviewText: If you look closely at the cover for this (and I hope all of you placing online order ALWAYS do this), it's obvious that this is some kind of chinese copy of this film that they've manufactured for all regions with NTSC so it plays in North American dvd players.Now, if a film is hard enough to obtain, I have no qualms with getting it by whatever means necessary in order to see it (and that includes grey market sellers), but when it comes to "reputable" sites (like I'd like to believe Amaznn is), I expect them to abide by a slightly higher standard. And part of that is knowing I'm buying a product that at least has some resell value should I decide to resell it later.In that regard, anyone who is actually considering paying $15.49 for this disc (it's price as of date of this review) and thinking this will hold it's value enough to get at least half their money back should they decide to resell it is sorely mistaken. Wait a few months and you'll be able to find this for a couple of bucks used on certain auction sites all over the web. As this was manufactured in Hong Kong, it has almost zero collectible value.
summary: Since when are Chinese knock-offs sold here?
